alert.note: Alert for Adair; Casey; Russell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 11:50AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Russell, south central Casey and east central Adair Counties through 1215 PM EDT/1115 AM CDT/... At 1149 AM EDT/1049 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Liberty, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Russell, south central Casey and east central Adair Counties, including the following locations... Windsor, Pellyton, Teddy, Dunnville, Gilpin, Rubert Ford, Cantown, Decatur, Evans Ford and Evona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
